page.title: 01REVIEW OF BLOCK 04200420
page.content: Although{Dewsbury is the main town}in the area, only the western side (Ravensthorpe, Boothroyd and Dewsbury Moor) falls within our block; this excludes the town centre. A large part of{Mirfield}occupies the south-west corner, with{Norristhorpe}in the north-west. It is largely{residential,}but there are substantial areas of open land, which are mainly{farming}fields, public recreational areas, disused industrial sites or waste-land. {Textiles}is the predominant{industry, and there are also several small engineering and chemical works. The majority of the population is working class, although parts of Mirfield house executive commuters to surrounding cities. Recently there has been a large influx of{Asian families into Ravensthorpe.
